Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interio glazed streaky brown with two added red bands; exterior reserved with trace of two narrow brown lines; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0954) (phase 2)
